skill.name: docs-write
skill.description: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when creating or editing documentation files (markdown, MDX, etc.).

skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown writing guidelines. No executable code exists. Static findings are false positives: backticks in markdown examples were misinterpreted as shell execution, angle brackets in placeholder syntax were flagged as cryptographic issues, and scanner hallucinated Windows SAM database references that do not exist. The skill only provides documentation writing instructions.

content.value_statement: Documentation often frustrates readers with jargon and unnecessary complexity. This skill provides clear guidelines for writing conversational, user-focused documentation that helps people find answers fast.
actual_capabilities: Create markdown documentation files following Metabase style
Edit existing documentation with consistent voice and tone
Format instructions with clear action steps
Apply American spelling and serial commas
Run prettier for consistent documentation formatting
limitations: Does not generate code examples (only documentation about code)
Does not handle translations or localization

use_cases.title: Create documentation guides
use_cases.description: Write new markdown documentation following established style patterns and voice guidelines.

use_cases.title: Document features
use_cases.description: Add or update feature documentation with clear instructions and examples.

use_cases.title: Apply consistent style
use_cases.description: Edit any documentation file to match Metabase conversational style standards.

prompt_templates.title: Write new docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Write documentation for [feature/topic] in markdown. Include clear steps, practical examples, and links to related content.

prompt_templates.title: Edit existing docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and edit this documentation for clarity and style. Lead with actions, cut filler, use descriptive headings.

prompt_templates.title: Format instructions
prompt_templates.prompt: Write step-by-step instructions for [task]. Use code blocks for commands, bold for UI elements, and explain context after steps.

prompt_templates.title: Apply style guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Metabase style guidelines to this documentation: conversational tone, action-first steps, descriptive links, no jargon.

output_examples.input: Write documentation for setting up SAML authentication
output: Start with the action: Configure SAML before adding users
Use code blocks for commands in execution order
Bold UI elements like Save button
Explain context after steps, not before
Include answers to common questions without framing them as questions

output_examples.input: Edit this documentation to be more conversational
output: Replace formal language with conversational tone
Lead with what to do, then explain why
Use headings that state the actual point

best_practices: Match complexity to your audience - do not oversimplify hard topics or overcomplicate simple ones
Lead with the ask, then explain why - put action before explanation
Use headings that state your point, not just the topic - write Set SAML before adding users not SAML configuration
anti_patterns: Using we when talking about product features - say Metabase or it instead
Using corporate jargon like utilize, reference, or offerings
Describing tasks as easy or simple - you do not know the readers context

faq.question: What file types does this skill support?
faq.answer: Markdown (md), MDX, and other documentation file formats commonly used in documentation projects.

faq.question: Does this skill handle formatting?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes guidance to run prettier for consistent formatting after edits.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with other writing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use it alongside any editor or writing tool.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my documentation?
faq.answer: The skill only accesses files you explicitly open or edit. No data is stored externally.

faq.question: What if my documentation uses a different style?
faq.answer: The skill applies Metabase style specifically. Adapt the guidelines for other style requirements as needed.

faq.question: How is this different from general writing skills?
faq.answer: This skill enforces specific patterns: action-first instructions, conversational tone, no jargon, descriptive links, and UI element formatting.
